languageTools.program.mas

Class MASProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • languageTools.program.mas.MASProgram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>

    public class MASProgram
extends ParsedObject
    A MAS-program consists of
    • optionally: an environment info block, containing:
      • a non-empty list of jar files each being an EIS environment
      • an initializer for the first environment.
    • a list of paths to GOAL-programs,
    • a list of launches, and
    • a list of launch-rules.

    It is the MAS-parser that translates .mas-files to MAS-programs.

    Launches are applied only once and instantiate agents without connections to environment-interfaces. Launch-rules can be applied during the execution of the MAS, as long/often as they are applicable.

    After parsing you have to process the MAS-program with the respective method. This resolves file-names.

    Author:
    tristanbehrens, W.Pasman 2mar10 added multiple jar and initializer support
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • isValidated

        public boolean isValidated()
        check if MAS strongly validates. If the MAS file validates, this means that both the MAS and all the files it refers to are both syntactically and semantically correct. The MAS is ready to run.
        Returns:
        true if the MAS file validates, false if not.

      • postProcess

        public void postProcess()
        Resolves agent labels and file names.

        Does not check for inconsistencies. A MASProgramValidator must be used for that.
